beer.beer_description:
Hazy IPA 6.8%

You’ll be catching vibes left and right after one sip of this.

We started off with Motueka Whole cone mash hop and added Citra T90 in the kettle. Then, we threw HBC-522, Centennial CRYO & MORE Citra in the whirlpool to achieve that herbal and bright, citrusy tropical flavors. Topped off HBC-630, HQG#4 Citra CRYO and YCH-805 for late dry hopping.

AROMA:
orange zest, tropical, hint of berry
FLAVOR:
bright orange, pineapple, grapefruit, mango & pine
Named after our favorite ski run in Steamboat Springs, Co, this heavily dry hopped IPA has loads of Mosaic Powder, Citra Hops, and Simcoe Powder. This hop blend is best described Dank Citrus.

beer.beer_description:
Hazy IPA 6.8%

You’ll be catching vibes left and right after one sip of this.

We started off with Motueka Whole cone mash hop and added Citra T90 in the kettle. Then, we threw HBC-522, Centennial CRYO & MORE Citra in the whirlpool to achieve that herbal and bright, citrusy tropical flavors. Topped off HBC-630, HQG#4 Citra CRYO and YCH-805 for late dry hopping.

AROMA:
orange zest, tropical, hint of berry
FLAVOR:
bright orange, pineapple, grapefruit, mango & pine

For this beer we utilized a proprietary blend of four different hop varieties highlighting Centennial hops. The result is a beer that’s crisp, citrusy, and incredibly balanced. 5.6% ABV

We’re excited to continue Andrew Zilker’s spirit of philanthropy by donating a portion of the sales proceeds from the “Parks & Rec” to the Austin Parks Foundation.

beer.beer_description:
Hazy IPA 6.8%

You’ll be catching vibes left and right after one sip of this.

We started off with Motueka Whole cone mash hop and added Citra T90 in the kettle. Then, we threw HBC-522, Centennial CRYO & MORE Citra in the whirlpool to achieve that herbal and bright, citrusy tropical flavors. Topped off HBC-630, HQG#4 Citra CRYO and YCH-805 for late dry hopping.

AROMA:
orange zest, tropical, hint of berry
FLAVOR:
bright orange, pineapple, grapefruit, mango & pine
Refreshing rice lager with saaz, pilsner, toasted flaked rice, and carafoam

This Festbier Lager is not to be confused with it’s maltier sibling, the Marzen lager; Wunderbier is as light and crispy as they come. For our modern take on this Oktoberfest style lager we used Hallertau Mittelfruh & Tettnang hops with Munich & Pilsner malts which lends to a subtle burst of biscuity flavors.

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 46)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 47!

beer.beer_description: Equally suited for the boat dock or the dining table, our full-bodied American IPA is rich in color (burnt orange) and flavor (tropical fruit and pine), and features El Dorado and Simcoe hops.

Inspired by Cafe’ Cubano, this sweet stout features coffee from local Austin roasters, The result is a big roasty milk stout, well balanced with notes of coffee, chocolate, caramelized sugar, and hints of vanilla.
Named after our favorite ski run in Steamboat Springs, Co, this heavily dry hopped IPA has loads of Mosaic Powder, Citra Hops, and Simcoe Powder. This hop blend is best described Dank Citrus.

For this beer we utilized a proprietary blend of four different hop varieties highlighting Centennial hops. The result is a beer that’s crisp, citrusy, and incredibly balanced. 5.6% ABV

We’re excited to continue Andrew Zilker’s spirit of philanthropy by donating a portion of the sales proceeds from the “Parks & Rec” to the Austin Parks Foundation.
Refreshing rice lager with saaz, pilsner, toasted flaked rice, and carafoam
A light, crisp, and balanced American Blonde Ale.  A touch of local honey rounds out the German pilsner malt that is the base of this easy drinker.

Snake Juice is a 9% double IPA characterized by intense tropical flavor profiles. The Zilker Brewing team combined Azacca, Citra, and Hallertau Blanc hops with a simple grain combination, to allow the hops flavors to scream. While a normal IPA has about 2-3 pounds of hops per barrel, Snake Juice requires 11 pounds of hops per barrel.
Kettle Sour with 400 lbs of blackberry puree added.

Imperial Coffee Milk Stout w/cocoa nibs. Expect everything you love about the original Coffee Milk Stout, the caramelized sugar, the creamy texture, and of course the locally roasted coffee (thanks Wild Gift Coffee), just more of it!
A light and crisp ale with 400 lbs of peach puree added post fermentation.

A true to style German Pilsner with a snappy refreshing finish.  Imported German hops add a slight floral freshness to the simple and clean malt profile.
ABV - 4.8%
Malt - German Pilsner, Carafoam
Hops - Hallertauer Mittelfruh, Northern Brewer, Pearle
Yeast - German Augustiner 
Bitterness - 38 IBUs
Color - 2.0 SRM

This time we used a dank blend of Galaxy, Mosaic, Mosaic cryo, and Azacca cryo hops bursting with tropical notes and bright citrus. We decided to lighten up the body a touch to leave a nice dry finish, extenuating the quality of these hops. It’s the perfect change up from that 20-percenter you’ve been nursing..

CAMP BEER ⛺️
Hazy Pale Ale 5.3%
Made in collaboration with @offandout

Camp Beer is an ode to that moment where nothing else matters but the company you’re with, the shooting star nobody else saw, and deciding how toasty is too toasty for a marshmallow.

Our newest hazy provides a pillowy and zesty drinking experience. It’s pineapple, mango, and key lime flavors are softened by its peachy undertone. It’s juicier than your typical hazy pale stemming from a 5 star experimental hop combo by @yakimachief.

A Texan take on an English classic.  This ale greets you with a crisp bitterness, but then quickly brings forth it’s malt complexity. Rich and toasty malts dominate and set this beer apart from its caramel driven English counterparts.  Balance is always key, as this beer has excellent quaffability and plenty of flavor to stimulate your taste buds indefinitely.
This brew is a tart and colorful combo of blueberries and boysenberry. Complete with a monster inspired can by Gerardo himself.

Here’s the skinny... we tripled the amount of hops that are in the original Marco IPA. We kept the El Dorado hops Marco is built on and added Citra and Mosaic hops to transform the mainstay brew into a juicer hazy experience.
Hazy, light bodied, Azacca Hops
Margarita inspired kettle sour. With salt or without.

Made in collaboration with La Barbecue

The common thread we share is that time yields quality- whether you're smoking a brisket for 16 hours or waiting weeks for a batch of hops and yeast to ferment, it's always worth the wait...

la Beer provides a familiar American light lager drinking experience, but a cut above your typical macro shelf staples. We used premium German Pilsner Malt and a touch of corn to enhance the typical light lager malt character. The quality German Hallertau Mittelfruh hops have created a subtle floral hop element and the thorough fermentation leads to a dry and crispy finish. la Beer is the ultimate pairing for la Barbecue’s raved about meats. So, crack a cold one, have some cue and enjoy the benefits of time.

Not to be confused with its maltier sibling, the Marzen lager; this golden modern day Oktoberfest style lager is the preferred style for the Oktoberfest celebration in Munich, Germany.  It’s crisp yet malt forward mouthfeel is achieved using a 3-step mash process and a thorough fermentation and lagering schedule. 5.5% ABV [draft only]

beer.beer_name: Nuthin' But A C Thang IPA
beer.beer_description: The latest in our rotating Taproom IPA series, this hop forward beer has loads of Centennial, Cascade, Chinook, and Crystal hops. These hops bring an original taste from the PNW.

FUTURE YOU
Schwarzbier 4.9%

Now that the sun has set on last year you may be asking yourself what’s next? Or what’s in store for future you... And sometimes figuring that out can take a minute, so here’s something to sip on while you seek inspiration.

This dark lager is rich and crisp. With subtle notes of chocolate, caramel and coffee followed by the refreshing lightness of the lagers you love. Here’s to all the places you will go, here’s to seeing all your favorite people and here’s to future you.

This one pours a beautiful light yellow with an amazing frothy head. Started with a base of pilsner malt, then played around with other malts that we typically don’t use; malted oats, flaked barley and chit malt. This combination creates a super full body upfront with a clean almost dry finish; perfect when its 104 out...
We dipped into our Galaxy hops on this one, and complemented it with Simcoe cryo and Azacca cryo, giving off a ripe pineapple flavor with an overall tropical complexity. We may have brewed this with another East Side brewery.

Flemish for Table Beer, this straw colored Belgian session ale provides the complexities of a Belgian beer without the intoxicating efficacy of its high alcohol brethren.  You’ll find it dry, complex, and quaffable.

We had a blast with our amigos over @southernheightsbrewing on this one. We continue to tweak our processes with this style, and are stoked about how it turned out?! Citra, Galaxy, Sabro, Motueka, and Chinook hops were added in ridiculous amounts to give off aromas of bright citrus, guava, coconut, and a touch of dankness. Pale malt, oats, and lactose provide a smooth, supple mouthfeel, and our house yeast provides added complexity.
